items.title: Andrew Hastie rules out challenge to Sussan Ley
items.description: The West Australian backbencher had made no secret of his desire to lead the Liberal party but says he will not run against Sussan Ley this week, a move which could pave the way for Angus Taylor.

items.title: 'Devastating tragedy': Perth family dead in suspected murder-suicide
items.description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

items.title: More human remains, 'Celine Cremer's jacket' found in river search
items.description: More human remains and a jacket believed to belong to missing backpacker Celine Cremer have been found in a search of Tasmania's Arthur River, police say.

items.title: Last-ditch deal sees government give states extra $25b in hospital funding
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bowed to mounting pressure from the states, promising an extra $25 billion for public hospitals.

items.title: Gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante charged with family violence
items.description: Australian online gambling billionaire Laurence Escalante has appeared in a Perth court, accused of a slew of family violence, drugs and burglary offences.

items.title: Live: Carlos Alcaraz through to first Australian Open final after five-hour epic
items.description: Carlos Alcaraz beats Alexander Zverev in the third-longest Australian Open match ever to reach his first final at Melbourne Park. Follow live.

items.title: Precious metal market crashes
items.description: Gold and silver prices have plummeted, sparked by reports US President Donald Trump is set to announce a new US Federal Reserve chair.

items.title: The NDIS was set up to relieve families. For some, it now does the opposite
items.description: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that is set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

items.title: Darwin Port deal 'true test' for Albanese as farmers fear more tariff pain
items.description: Industry groups that suffered three years of damaging Chinese trade tariffs on products including barley are appealing to the federal government to exercise careful diplomacy to defuse tensions with China over the ownership of Darwin Port.

items.title: 50C record for Port Augusta ahead of cool change
items.description: For the first time in four years, Australia has recorded temperatures in excess of 50C, with both locations in South Australia.

items.title: The US looks poised to strike Iran — but what is Trump's endgame?
items.description: As the "massive armada" of the United States approaches Iran to be in place for a possible military attack, a key question remains: what can such firepower actually achieve?

items.title: Western nations decline to join 'Board of Peace' as Middle Eastern powers accept
items.description: New Zealand has declined Donald Trump's invitation to join his Board of Peace and is calling for "clarity" over the proposal. Here's where other countries stand.

items.title: Why are FBI agents seizing boxes of 2020 election documents in Georgia?
items.description: Fulton County, which votes overwhelmingly Democratic, has been a target of President Donald Trump since he narrowly lost the 2020 presidential election in Georgia to Democrat Joe Biden.

items.title: Why your sunscreen application might be putting your good intentions to waste
items.description: This is what three experts had to say about how to get the best protection from your sunscreen.

items.title: Bushfire-affected Victorian communities to get $160 million funding boost
items.description: The state and federal governments will substantially increase financial support for 23 Victorian local government areas devastated by bushfires this month.

items.title: 'Traditional media is dying': Nine sells radio stations for $56m
items.description: Arthur Laundy's Laundy Family Office acquires a network that includes Melbourne's top-rating talk station 3AW, Sydney's 2GB and outspoken conservative presenters such as Ben Fordham and Tom Elliott.

items.title: These 10 albums from 1996 changed music forever
items.description: From Weezer's raw emotion to the Spice Girls's pop revolution, revisit 10 iconic albums that made 1996 a landmark year in music. 30 years on, they still define the era.

items.title: Australia taking Nipah virus seriously but no changes to border control
items.description: The federal government is closely monitoring an outbreak of Nipah virus in India but has not received any advice to tighten border controls at this stage.

items.title: Man jailed over antisemitic graffiti and arson fails to have sentence overturned
items.description: Mohommed Farhat's lawyers were urging the court to overturn the sentence on appeal and replace it with an intensive correction order which could have seen him released.

items.title: NSW man found guilty of sexually abusing children in WA's Kimberley
items.description: The 23-year-old man has been found guilty of indecently dealing with two girls in northern Western Australia.

items.title: In following his own theory, man finds human remains that could be Celine Cremer’s
items.description: Celine Cremer went missing in 2023 from a track in a remote part of Tasmania's north-west. With several recent discoveries in the area, these are the theories of what could have happened.

items.title: Charge laid after allegedly stolen car crashes into Geelong school bus
items.description: A 43-year-old woman has been charged with handling stolen goods after a dramatic incident that saw police open fire at a vehicle that allegedly drove at officers after crashing into a bus on Thursday afternoon.

items.title: 'Heartbreaking' that Tim Picton couldn't be organ donor, brother says
items.description: In his first interview since the death of his brother Tim, SA's Health Minister Chris Picton reflects on the profound emotional impact of the loss on their family, his reluctance to watch the CCTV footage, and his brother's inability to become an organ donor "because of the coronial process".

items.title: Trump shares video of Alex Pretti confrontation with agents 11 days before shooting
items.description: United States President Donald Trump has shared a video on Truth Social showing Alex Pretti in a confrontation with federal immigration agents 11 days before the intensive care nurse was fatally shot during a separate encounter with Border Patrol agents.

items.title: Trump threatens fresh tariffs on 10 countries in almost as many days
items.description: In the past fortnight, US President Donald Trump has threatened tariffs against at least 10 countries. Some experts say the Trump administration's tariff policy is leading to the creation of new trading blocs, and isolating the United States.
